alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 3:37PM MDT until May 26 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a Flood Advisory for the following river in Wyoming... Wind River near Dubois affecting Fremont County. .Above normal temperatures continue through the week with scattered afternoon and evening showers and thunderstorms, especially Thursday and Friday. Therefore, active snowmelt persists in the mountains increasing water flows in the Wind River headwaters above Dubois. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Wind River near Dubois. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 4.5 feet, Bankfull stage. At 5.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor low level flooding possible upstream and downstream. Flooding of low areas in Dubois. At 5.5 feet, Record flow---1,940 cfs (6/8/1972). At 5.5 feet, Low land flooding intensifies and becomes more widespread in and around Dubois. At 5.7 feet, Record stage (6/2/1956). At 6.0 feet, High water may reach low-lying property downstream. High water problems should be monitored in Dubois. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM MDT Tuesday, May 23, the stage was 4.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate each day between 4.1 and 4.6 feet. Daily crests around 4.6 feet are likely to occur between 2 AM and 4 AM. - Action stage is 4.5 feet. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The fast-moving water may have eroded the soil beneath the bank. Also, do not attempt to swim in the river, as the water is swift and cold. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/riverton.
